blocks.text: Toggle features to approximate Bosniak class. Enhancement: CT HU >10 or conspicuous MRI post-contrast/subtraction.
Hyperattenuating, homogeneous >=70 HU on NC CT (<=3 cm), no enhancement
No measurable enhancement (HU < 10 or visually none)

items: Modality cues: CT enhancement = HU > 10; MRI enhancement = visual conspicuity on subtraction or T1 post vs pre.
I: Simple cyst, water attenuation/signal, no septa or enhancement.
II (CT): 1-3 thin (<2 mm) septa or fine calcification; homogeneous >=70 HU <=3 cm non-enhancing; non-enhancing <30 HU benign.
II (MRI): 1-3 thin (<2 mm) septa or fine calcification; homogeneous simple fluid without enhancement.
IIF (CT): >=4 thin septa or minimally thick (3 mm) smooth enhancing wall/septa; homogeneous hyperattenuating >3 cm without enhancement.
IIF (MRI): >=4 thin septa or minimally thick (3 mm) smooth enhancing wall/septa.
III: Smooth thickened (>=4 mm) enhancing wall/septa or smooth <=3 mm enhancing nodules.
IV: Enhancing nodules >3 mm, irregular enhancing tissue, or definite solid enhancing component.

blocks.text: Follow-up ideas (institution-dependent): I/II: none. IIF: 6-12 months, then yearly up to 5 years. III/IV: urology consultation; consider surgery/ablation vs. surveillance if comorbidities.

items: Class I: Simple cyst, imperceptible wall, water density/signal, no septa or calcification; benign, no follow-up.
Class II: Few (<=3) thin (<2 mm) septa, fine calcification, or homogeneous hyperattenuating <=3 cm without enhancement; benign, no follow-up.
Class IIF: >=4 thin septa or minimal smooth thickening (~3 mm), may have thick/irregular calcification; hyperattenuating >3 cm without enhancement; likely benign, imaging follow-up recommended.
Class III: Smoothly thickened (>=4 mm) enhancing wall/septa or small (<=3 mm) enhancing mural nodules; indeterminate ~50% malignant-urology consult.
Class IV: Enhancing nodules >3 mm, irregular enhancing tissue, or solid enhancing components; high malignant probability-urology consult.
Enhancement: CT HU >10; MRI visual/subtraction. Avoid class II/III calls without clear enhancement.
Follow-up (typical): I/II none; IIF at 6-12 months then yearly up to 5 years; III/IV urology consult (surgery/ablation vs surveillance in select patients).

blocks.text: Source: pcheng.org Bosniak reference and Bosniak 2019 update.
